function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Testing interrater reliability and refining criteria among researchers could increase the risk of disease transmission in case of close collaboration in a high-risk environment.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unsanitary interview conditions may promote the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Close proximity during interviews may increase the risk of disease transmission","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extended data collection process may expose interviewees and interviewers to multiple sources of contagion","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases during in-person interviews and meetings","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Communicating intention for startup specific support early may lead to the gathering of large groups of individuals in physical spaces, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The presence of fewer than 100 cases of covid-19 in some countries may lead to a false sense of security and reduce the urgency of implementing effective measures to mitigate the spread of the virus.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Startups relying heavily on relational capabilities may lead to increased risk of disease propagation through close contact and interaction with partners and the startup community.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cognizance of customers’ shifting needs may lead to increased risk of disease spread if startups are unable to adapt and respond to changes in customer behavior.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cases with no known travel history contributing to disseminating sars-cov-2 outside of wuhan","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Containment of respiratory infections characterized by mild symptoms or pre-symptomatic transmission","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased testing capacity coinciding with the travel ban","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Importation of cases from wuhan contributing to local transmission in neighboring and distant provinces","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher growth rates of the epidemic in provinces outside of hubei before travel restrictions and control measures were implemented","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19 due to unrestricted mobility and travel","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local transmission of covid-19 cases outside of wuhan","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Identifying themes and high-risk features from online posts to inform mental health interventions","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate control of contagious disease spread due to the presence of statistical noise in the data processing and modeling.","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased prevalence of mental health outcomes during covid-19","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"No in vitro data on efficacy of hand washing against coronavirus contamination on hands.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compliance with hand hygiene is likely to remain an obstacle, especially among physicians.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Human coronaviruses can remain infectious on inanimate surfaces for up to 9 days.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain viral load on inanimate surfaces","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conflicting data on benzalkonium chloride efficacy against coronavirus at different concentrations and contact times.","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long persistence of coronaviruses on inanimate surfaces, up to 9 days at room temperature and 28 days at higher temperatures.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transfer efficiency of viral load to hands from contaminated surfaces, with potential transfer to the face and mucous membranes.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Coronavirus persistence on surfaces and materials","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in coronavirus persistence based on temperature and humidity","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of coronavirus in hospital and family settings.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated dry surfaces serving as a potential source of coronavirus transmission.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of coronavirus persistence on inanimate surfaces.","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through shared personal comfort systems pcs in the built environment.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Scientific studies on indoor air quality","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher density associated with higher rates of mortality from and transmission of highly contagious diseases, including covid-19.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased emphasis on outdoor space may lead to overcrowding in outdoor public spaces, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid adoption of smart-home technology may lead to a false sense of security, neglecting traditional cleaning and disinfection practices.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for home amenities like pools, waterfronts, and docks may lead to overcrowding and increased contact, contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Growing interest in gourmet kitchens may result in greater use of communal cooking and dining spaces, leading to potential contamination and the spread of foodborne illnesses.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Blurring lines between work and home life could lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases within households.","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Technology-facilitated real-time residential management could lead to increased exposure to contagious diseases if not implemented with appropriate health and safety protocols.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in homebuyer preferences and housing locations due to covid-19 could lead to spread of contagious diseases in new residential areas.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for increased density in urban areas due to the need for affordable housing. this could lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of infection in cities due to close contact in vulnerable households, construction sites, and local businesses.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential long-term coexistence with covid-19 leading to ongoing public health concerns and the need for sustainable recovery strategies.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misallocation of resources in coronavirus response, diverting attention from other contagious diseases like influenza.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enhanced detection and lower hospitalization thresholds may strain healthcare systems and increase mortality from other serious diseases.","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient evidence for entry port screening and social distancing","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clear evidence on protective measures","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of the infection fatality rate due to uncounted deaths and undiagnosed infections","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"}]}
